intro: Narcissus baeticus, commonly known as the Baeticus daffodil, is a species native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family, characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a white corona. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces clusters of flowers in early spring. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
